intro: Dumula, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant has a robust root system that allows it to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its leaves are typically narrow and succulent, storing water to withstand drought. Dumula is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in areas with minimal rainfall.
